intro: Trigonella turkmena, commonly known as Turkmen fenugreek, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are trifoliate, and the flowers are small and yellow, typical of the legume family. The seeds are often used in traditional medicine and as a spice in some cuisines.
